Breadth-First.Explanation: General clue collection listing multiple image features (arch, Doric columns, sunset orientation) without a specific location hypothesis.

Depth-First.Explanation: Verifying the specific hypothesis (Brandenburg Gate) by focusing on fine details
Depth-First.KeyElement: Brandenburg Gate hypothesis and features like streetlights, people’s attire, underground entrance

Depth-First.Explanation: Deriving precise location hypotheses based on key clues
Depth-First.KeyElement: Western side of the gate (Straße des 17. Juni or Tiergarten park)

Depth-First.Explanation: Verifying the precise spot using specific features and external validation
Depth-First.KeyElement: DZ BANK sign and U-Bahn station entrance along Straße des 17. Juni
U-Bahn station exit at Pariser Platz

Depth-First.Explanation: Integrating all observations to refine to a specific street
Depth-First.KeyElement: Unter den Linden as main thoroughfare

Depth-First.Explanation: Structuring essential elements to finalize street and neighborhood
Depth-First.KeyElement: Street perspective, U-Bahn entrance on Unter den Linden, DZ BANK sign

Depth-First.Explanation: Evaluating final details and selecting between two adjacent locations
Depth-First.KeyElement: Decision between Pariser Platz or Straße des 17. Juni

Depth-First.Explanation: Assessing response format requirements and choosing a street name
Depth-First.KeyElement: Prompt format vs street-name example leading to Unter den Linden

Depth-First.Explanation: Solidifying the response choice based on specificity and familiarity
Re-evaluating and selecting Pariser Platz as the final answer
Final confirmation of the chosen location in required format

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: After initial broad observation, the model converges on a specific hypothesis (Brandenburg Gate) and begins detailed verification.
